source.name: Regular Expressions: Matching Single Characters and Words
source.instructions:
### Consider the lines of information inside a file called `flowers.txt`. ```tex -hide-clipboard Loosestrife Aster Rose of Sharon Hydrangea Lantana Marigold ``` ### What would be the result of the following command? ```bash-hide-clipboard grep -E [bcdf] flowers.txt ```

Click the button below to submit.

---

answers.answer:
Loosestrife
Rose of Sharon
Hydrangea
Marigold

source.guidance:
The code above will return each line containing at least one occurrence of any letter within the defined list, `bcdf`. The command will return the following lines.

```bash
Loosestrife
Rose of Sharon
Hydrangea
Marigold
```
